headline.main: FROM BUENOS AYRES.; Effect of War News on Buenos Ayres-Sale of Vessels Trouble No Secession Flag Here U.S. Man-of-War Pulaski History Unfitness U.S. Minister, Mr. Palmer J. B. Bond, Esq. Foreign Ministers a Headless, Memberless Government Gov.Mitre Varied Abilities San FernandoRailroad Our New United States Consul Arrived Vessels go in Ballast Why it is so Markets, &c.

docs.abstract: Observations from Great Britain, France and Buenos Aires
docs.lead_paragraph: The recent threatening of hostilities between the United States and Great Britain has affected the quiet La Plata as would a terrific storm. For more then a month all the vessels that came in stayed, except here and there an adventurous bark. Purchases for the United States or for England were nearly suspended. One American vessel, the Brothers, was sold to sail in future under a German flag, and two Balti- more vessels changed flags.

docs.snippet: The gallant fighting of the National soldiers under Gen. McCLELLAN on Monday was too much for the rebels, and on Tuesday night they evacuated their new position at Williamsburgh, and continued their retreat toward Richmond, followed on Tuesday...
docs.lead_paragraph: The gallant fighting of the National soldiers under Gen. McCLELLAN on Monday was too much for the rebels, and on Tuesday night they evacuated their new position at Williamsburgh, and continued their retreat toward Richmond, followed on Tuesday morning by our victorious troops.
